response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("age", "high", "At 21 years old, youth is statistically associated with higher recidivism risk."),
    ("race", "medium", "Being Black is associated with systemic factors that may increase challenges post-arrest, though race itself is not a causal factor."),
    ("arrest record", "medium", "Two prior arrests, even without conviction, indicate prior contact with the justice system and potential risk."),
    ("marital and living status", "medium", "Never married and living alone could imply limited social support, a factor linked with increased risk."),
    ("education", "medium", "Having only a high school diploma and not being enrolled in further education may limit socio-economic mobility, correlating with risk."),
    ("employment", "medium", "Holding only one job during the past year suggests employment instability, which is associated with higher recidivism risk."),
    ("drug use", "low", "No drug use in the past four years is a protective factor."),
    ("mental health", "low", "Not feeling depressed recently is a protective factor regarding recidivism."),
    ("household background", "medium", "Growing up in a household of five may indicate complex family dynamics affecting early development, though its impact is moderate."),
    ("religious belief", "low", "Belief that God has a role in personal outcomes can provide resilience and a positive outlook, serving as a protective factor.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 65
}

risk_factors: At 21 years old, youth is statistically associated with higher recidivism risk.
Being Black is associated with systemic factors that may increase challenges post-arrest, though race itself is not a causal factor.
Two prior arrests, even without conviction, indicate prior contact with the justice system and potential risk.
Never married and living alone could imply limited social support, a factor linked with increased risk.
Having only a high school diploma and not being enrolled in further education may limit socio-economic mobility, correlating with risk.
Holding only one job during the past year suggests employment instability, which is associated with higher recidivism risk.
No drug use in the past four years is a protective factor.
Not feeling depressed recently is a protective factor regarding recidivism.
Growing up in a household of five may indicate complex family dynamics affecting early development, though its impact is moderate.
Belief that God has a role in personal outcomes can provide resilience and a positive outlook, serving as a protective factor.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 2 times but has not been convicted. He is 6 feet 1 inch and weighs 170 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived in a household of size 5. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
